nodes.bodyText: haha destruct operator for arrays ... very tricky thing for non js devs ;)
Yes, it is - i googled twice! ;)
return true is missing? not  needed?
No, because the return value is never catched.
It's definitely intended because a function should always return a value fro the same type - in this case boolean.

I inserted the if case by inserting ' = taskQueryResource.taskHistoryEvents ? ...'
So we get the same behavior in two lines and without an empty return statement
